input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is HPSEActor

1. Stops running performance data collection schedules Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>stop</command> <category>configuration</category> <process-id>stop-schedule</process-id> <command-arguments> <performance> <datacollection-ids>1001 1003</datacollection-ids> </performance> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. performance[Required] Indicates the performance schedules datacollection-ids[Required] ids of performance datacollection schedules to be stopped. The list should be separated by space.
2. Stops running reports data collection schedule Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>stop</command> <category>configuration</category> <process-id>stop-schedule</process-id> <command-arguments> <reports> <datacollection-ids>1001 1003</datacollection-ids> </reports> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. reports[Required] Indicates the performance schedules datacollection-ids[Required] ids of reports datacollection schedules to be stopped. The list should be separated by space.

documentation.description:
This wrapper supports the following requirements:-
1. Stops running performance data collection schedules. The schedule ID may be one or many. 2. Stops running reports data collection schedules. The Schedule ID may be one or many.
